page.title: 15RELIGION
page.content:
ST JAMES - Akeley was built in 1854 to replace the old thatched building and demolished as unsafe in 1981. A foun- dation stone inscribed To the memory of William, son of Dr Smythe, 1691' was found indicating an earlier building on site. Fossilised cockles and ammomites found in the churchyard suggest area was once sea. Services are held in church school but few attend, many are embittered by the loss of their church. This church is 1 of 5 forming the North Buckingham Parish, administered from Maids Moreton, so service times vary.
AKELEY METHODIST - Services are held every Sunday in their own hall, also a Sunday School for youngsters. Poor attendance threatens the future as well as condition of building.
